source.title: A recurrent network model of planning explains hippocampal replay and human behavior

confidence_rationale: The model explicitly couples prefrontal control with hippocampal replay rollouts, supporting a trajectory-first decision-control pathway with downstream behavioral benefit.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Planning can be implemented through prefrontal-controlled hippocampal rollouts that improve behavior when selectively engaged.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports hybrid MECH-056 implementation where trajectory-first operations are retained but gated by explicit control-plane logic rather than unconstrained rollout dominance.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Computational-neuroscience bridge, not direct causal connectome perturbation; requires empirical guardrail calibration in REE experiments.
mapping.source_context: Modeling work aligned with rodent replay signatures and human planning latency data.

confidence_components.notes: Strong cross-level bridge; moderate transfer risk due model dependence.
